question: Is portfolio planning done at the same frequency as daily Scrum meetings?
generated_answer: No, portfolio planning is not done at the same frequency as daily Scrum meetings. Portfolio planning typically occurs at a higher level and on a longer timeline, often focusing on a horizon of a year or more. It involves stakeholders and product owners and determines which products to work on, in what order, and for how long. In contrast, daily Scrum meetings are held every day during the sprint to synchronize activities and create a plan for the next 24 hours.
ground_truth_answer: No, portfolio planning and daily Scrum meetings occur at very different frequencies. Portfolio planning tends to focus on a horizon of a year or more, involving stakeholders and product owners to determine which products to work on. In contrast, daily Scrum meetings occur every work day at the same time, and are timeboxed to around 15 minutes.
